nationalyears3 = 2011 | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national under-20 football team|Spain U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 09:03, 20 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Francisco 'Kiko' Femenía Far''' ({{IPA-es|fɾanˈθisko femeˈni.a ˈfaɾ}}; born 2 February 1991) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
==Club career== ===Hércules=== Born in [[Sanet y Negrals]], [[Province of Alicante|Alicante]], [[Valencian Community]], Femenía was a product of [[Hércules CF]]'s youth ranks. He made his first-team debut on 15 June 2008 at just 17, appearing in a [[Segunda División]] match at [[Cádiz CF]], a 1–1 draw which eventually certified the [[Andalusia]]ns' [[2007–08 Segunda División|relegation]] even though they protested against the illegal fielding of an opposing player, specifically the youngster.<ref>[https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/futbol/confirmado-el-descenso-del-cadiz-a-segunda-b-5821759 Confirmado el descenso del Cádiz a Segunda B (Cádiz's relegation to ''Segunda B'' confirmed)]; [[Sport (Spanish newspaper)|Sport]], 4 July 2008 (in Spanish)</ref>
During the [[2008–09 Segunda División|2008–09 season]], Femenía played another game with the main squad, again in the last round but against [[UD Salamanca]] (5–1 away win).<ref>[http://www.marca.com/2009/06/20/futbol/2adivision/1245525955.html El Hércules se despide a lo grande (Hércules say goodbye in style)]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 20 June 2009 (in Spanish)</ref> In the subsequent off-season, he signed his first professional contract after penning a five-year link<ref>[http://www.laverdad.es/alicante/20090812/deportes_alicante/hercules/kiko-firmara-contrato-profesional-20090812.html Kiko firmará un contrato profesional por cinco temporadas con el Hércules (Kiko will sign five-year professional contract with Hércules)]; [[La Verdad (Murcia)|La Verdad]], 12 August 2009 (in Spanish)</ref> and, in [[2009–10 Segunda División|the following campaign]], still only 18, he would be a much more important midfield unit, being the first [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for veteran [[Francisco Rufete]] and appearing in nearly 1,000 minutes in the league to help the club return to [[La Liga]] after an absence of 13 years.
On 28 August 2010, Femenía made his debut in the top division, replacing [[Abel Aguilar]] in the second half of the home fixture against [[Athletic Bilbao]]: after only a few minutes on the pitch, however, and a couple of poor decisions, he suffered an [[Panic attack|anxiety attack]] from which he later fully recovered, although the [[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basques]] eventually won it 1–0.<ref>[http://elhercules.com/actualidad/59341-kiko-femenia-derrota-a-la-ansiedad Kiko Femenía derrota a la anxiedad (Kiko Femenía defeats anxiety)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100907004503/http://elhercules.com/actualidad/59341-kiko-femenia-derrota-a-la-ansiedad|date=7 September 2010}}; El Hércules, 31 August 2010 (in Spanish)</ref>
===Barcelona=== Femenía joined [[FC Barcelona B]] on 6 July 2011, for [[Euro|€]]2 million plus €1.5 million in add-ons.<ref>[http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada11-12/07/06/n110706118298.html Kiko Femenía se incorpora al Barça B (Kiko Femenía joins Barça B)]{{Dead link|date=September 2018|bot=InternetArchiveBot|fix-attempted=yes}}; FC Barcelona, 6 July 2011 (in Spanish)</ref> He scored his first official goal for his new team on 4 September, opening the score in a 4–0 away win against [[FC Cartagena]].<ref>[http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada11-12/09/04/n110904119055.html Exhibición del filial en Cartagena (0–4) (B-team power display in Cartagena (0–4))]{{Dead link|date=September 2018|bot=InternetArchiveBot|fix-attempted=yes}}; FC Barcelona, 4 September 2011 (in Spanish)</ref>
Femenía netted five times in 30 games – 23 starts – in [[2011–12 Segunda División|his first season]], helping the [[Catalonia|Catalans]] to the eighth position.
===Real Madrid=== In late August 2013, Femenía was released by Barcelona, stating that he had been "ruined emotionally".<ref>[http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1537132/kiko-femenia-slams-barcelona-leaves-real-madrid?cc=5739 Madrid-bound Femenia slams Barcelona]; [[ESPN FC]], 29 August 2013</ref> Just hours later, he signed for [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], being assigned to [[Real Madrid Castilla|the reserves]] in the second level.<ref>[https://archive.is/20130912114103/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/ActualidadCantera1314_en/News/1193040523950/1330157928677/noticia/Noticia/Kiko_Femenia,_new_Castilla_player.htm Kiko Femenia, new Castilla player]; Real Madrid C.F, 28 August 2013</ref>
Femenía appeared in only five matches during [[2013–14 Segunda División|the whole campaign]], which ended in relegation, and left the club in December 2014.
===Alcorcón=== On 7 January 2015, Femenía signed a six-month deal with [[AD Alcorcón]] also in the second tier.<ref>[http://adalcorcon.com/kiko-femenia-nuevo-futbolista-de-la-a-d-alcorcon/ Kiko Femenía, nuevo futbolista de la A.D. Alcorcón (Kiko Femenía, new footballer of A.D. Alcorcón)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150111013939/http://adalcorcon.com/kiko-femenia-nuevo-futbolista-de-la-a-d-alcorcon/|date=11 January 2015}}; AD Alcorcón, 7 January 2015 (in Spanish)</ref> He totalled 996 minutes of action during [[2014–15 Segunda División|the season]], helping his team finish 11th.
===Alavés=== On 2 July 2015, Femenía moved to fellow league side [[Deportivo Alavés]] after agreeing to a one-year contract.<ref>[http://www.deportivoalaves.com/el-deportivo-alaves-cierra-el-fichaje-de-kiko-femenia/ El Deportivo Alavés cierra el fichaje de Kiko Femenía (Deportivo Alavés complete the signing of Kiko Femenía)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702162556/http://www.deportivoalaves.com/el-deportivo-alaves-cierra-el-fichaje-de-kiko-femenia/|date=2 July 2015}}; Deportivo Alavés, 2 July 2015 (in Spanish)</ref> He contributed with 38 appearances and five goals in [[2015–16 Segunda División|his debut campaign]] as they returned to the top flight after ten years, and was eventually reconverted into a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]].<ref>[http://deportes.elpais.com/deportes/2016/05/29/actualidad/1464551891_854403.html El Alavés vuelve a Primera (Alavés return to ''Primera'')]; [[El País]], 29 May 2016 (in Spanish)</ref><ref>[https://www.vavel.com/es/futbol/alaves/680016-deportivo-alaves-1617-kiko-femenia.html Deportivo Alavés 2016/2017: Kiko Femenía (2016/2017 Deportivo Alavés: Kiko Femenía)]; [[Vavel]], 18 August 2016 (in Spanish)</ref>
Femenía left the club on 6 June 2017, as his contract was due to expire.<ref>[http://www.deportivoalaves.com/noticia/gracias-kiko-por-estas-2-temporadas-gloriosas Gracias Kiko por estas 2 temporadas Gloriosas (Thanks Kiko for these 2 Glorious seasons)]; Deportivo Alavés, 6 June 2017 (in Spanish)</ref>
===Watford=== On 1 July 2017, Femenía signed for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] after agreeing to a four-year deal.<ref>[https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-femenia-joins-hornets Official: Femenía joins Hornets]; Watford FC, 1 July 2017</ref> He made his debut in the [[Premier League]] on 12 August, coming on for injured [[Daryl Janmaat]] early into a 3–3 home draw against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/12/watford-vs-liverpool-premier-league-live-score-updates-team/ Watford 3 Liverpool 3: Miguel Britos scrambles home controversial injury-time equaliser in six-goal thriller]; [[The Daily Telegraph]], 12 August 2017</ref>
Femenía scored his first league goal for the English club on 31 March 2018, helping the hosts earn one point after a 2–2 home draw to [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/mar/31/watford-bournemouth-premier-league-match-report Jermain Defoe rescues late point for Bournemouth at Watford]; [[The Guardian]], 31 March 2018</ref>
==Club statistics== {{updated|match played 20 January 2019}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/francisco-femenia-far/58948/|title=Kiko Femenía|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=20 January 2019}}</ref>
